member.summary: Duration of the messagebox

member.name: T:SMI.GazeMonoBehaviour
member.summary: Base class for MonoBehaviour with gaze interaction. Inherit this class and add to your game object to implement gaze interaction behaviours.

member.name: F:SMI.GazeMonoBehaviour.isSelected
member.summary: Is true when the gaze ray hits with the object

member.name: M:SMI.GazeMonoBehaviour.OnElementHit(UnityEngine.RaycastHit)
member.summary: Inherited from MonoBehaviour. This function is called when ray cast is hit with the object.

member.name: M:SMI.GazeMonoBehaviour.OnObjectExit
member.summary: This function is called when gaze ray cast exits from the object.

member.name: M:SMI.GazeMonoBehaviour.OnGazeEnter(UnityEngine.RaycastHit)
member.summary: This function is called when the gaze enters the object

member.name: M:SMI.GazeMonoBehaviour.OnGazeStay(UnityEngine.RaycastHit)
member.summary: This function is called while the gaze stays on the object

member.name: M:SMI.GazeMonoBehaviour.OnGazeExit
member.summary: This function is called when the gaze exits the object

member.name: T:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity
member.summary: MonoBehaviour script to use the main functionalities of SMI's eye tracking HMD. Add this script to your camera game object to make use of the eye tracking functions. If you have at least one SMIEyeTrackingUnity component in your Unity scene, it creates a singleton instance which you can access from anywhere in your own script. The singleton instance can be accessed via SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.Instance.
MonoBehaviour script for eye tracking. Get the SMIEyeTrackingUnity singleton instance by SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.Instance.

member.name: T:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.SMIcWrapper
member.summary: C wrapper of the functions for the SMI HMD SDK

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.SMIcWrapper.smi_setCallback(System.Delegate)
member.summary: set the userFunction which should be called asynchronously when a gaze data sample is available
member.returns: returns SMI_RET_SUCCES if the callback function is set

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.SMIcWrapper.smi_stopStreaming
member.summary: stop the data streaming

member.name: T:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum
member.summary: eye tracking states

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum.SMI_STATE_INITIALIZED
member.summary: smi_init() has finished executing

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum.SMI_STATE_STREAMING
member.summary: smi_startStreaming() has been called

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum.SMI_STATE_SIMULATION_MODE
member.summary: the API is streaming pre-recorded data without connecting to the eye tracking server

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum.SMI_STATE_CONNECTED
member.summary: the API has successfully connected to the server or is in simulation mode

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum.SMI_STATE_CALIBRATING
member.summary: a calibration is being executed

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum.SMI_STATE_SHOWING_VALIDATION
member.summary: a live validation is shown

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum.SMI_STATE_EXECUTING_NUMERICAL_VALIDATION
member.summary: a numerical validation is being executed

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum.SMI_STATE_RUNNING_POSITIONAL_GUIDANCE
member.summary: a positional guidance is shown

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StateFlagEnum.SMI_STATE_SHOWING_LOADING_SCREEN
member.summary: the loading screen is shown

member.name: F:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.enableSMINotificationInVR
member.summary: if this value is true, a notification will appear in the VR space after executing an SMI eye tracking function (e.g., Reset calibration)

member.name: P:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.layerForGazeSelection
member.summary: gaze interaction can be limited to a specific layer, as a result the gaze ray collides with the selected layer only. This value cannot be changed during runtime

member.name: P:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.definedInputEvents
member.summary: SMI user input events set in inspector

member.name: T:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.CalibrationReturnCallback
member.summary: receives the calibration result when a calibration process is executed
member.param: return code of the calibration call
member.remarks:
a string type return message can be obtained by SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.errorIDContainer.getErrorMessage(CalibrationReturnCode)
SMI_SUCCESS: calibration was successfully done
SMI_OPERATION_FAILED: calibration process was aborted

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_SetCalibrationReturnCallback(SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.CalibrationReturnCallback)
member.summary: to receive the calibration results from the HMD API, set your own callback function
member.param: callback function for calibration return values

member.name: T:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.AsyncGazeSampleCallback
member.summary: receives individual gaze sample as soon as it is computed

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_SetAsyncGazeSampleCallback(SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.AsyncGazeSampleCallback)
member.summary: to receive gaze sample outside the Unity rendering loop, set your own gaze sample callback. The values you get within this callback are assured to be computed from the same time stamp images.
member.param: callback function for getting gaze samples at eye tracking frequency.

member.name: P:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.Instance
member.summary: use the instance to call SMI eye tracking functions

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.ManageGazeInput
member.summary: handle the Raycasting and Updating of the GazeBehaviours

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StartOnePointCalibration
member.summary: starts one-point calibration process

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StartThreePointCalibration
member.summary: starts 3-point motion based calibration process

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_StartFivePointCalibration
member.summary: starts 5-point motion based calibration process

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetRaycastHitFromGaze(UnityEngine.RaycastHit@)
member.summary: gets the hit information in case of a successful gaze ray cast
member.param: stores the information about the ray cast in the RaycastHit object
member.returns: returns true if the ray cast was sucessful

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetRayFromGaze
member.summary: returns the gaze ray in Unity 3D world space
member.returns: ray from the camera center to the binocular gaze direction

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetGazedObject
member.summary: returns the currently gazed at object based on a ray cast. This means that the first hit object will be returned.
member.returns: returns the gazed at object if found. Returns null if no object was hit by the gaze ray cast.

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_CloseVisualization
member.summary: closes visualization and abort the ongoing calibration or validation

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_ResetCalibration
member.summary: resets the calibration to 0-point

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetTimeStamp
member.summary: returns the timestamp from the latest available gaze sameple
member.returns: the timestamp from the latest available gaze sameple

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetLeftGazeBase
member.summary:
returns the latest available gaze base point (eye ball center) for the left eye [m]
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is lisenced and valid
member.returns: the latest available gaze base point (eye ball center) for the left eye

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetRightGazeBase
member.summary:
returns the latest available gaze base point (eye ball center) for the right eye [m]
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is lisenced and valid
member.returns: the latest available gaze base point (eye ball center) for the right eye

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetCameraRaycast
member.summary:
returns the latest available binocular direction for a raycast
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is valid
member.returns: the latest available direction for a raycast

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetLeftGazeDirection
member.summary:
returns the latest available left 3D gaze direction for the left eye
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is valid
member.returns: the latest available gaze direction for the left eye

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetRightGazeDirection
member.summary:
returns the latest available right 3D gaze direction for the right eye
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is valid
member.returns: the latest available gaze direction for the right eye

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetBinocularPor
member.summary:
returns the latest available binocular point of regard (POR) for the device
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is valid
member.returns: the latest available binocular POR

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetLeftPor
member.summary:
returns the latest available left eye point of regard (POR) for the device
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is lisenced and valid
member.returns: the latest available left eye POR

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetRightPor
member.summary:
returns the latest available right eye point of regard (POR) for the device
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is lisenced and valid
member.returns: the latest available eight eye POR

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetIPD
member.summary:
returns the latest available Interpupillary distance (IPD) [m]
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is valid
member.returns: the latest available IPD

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetIOD
member.summary:
return the latest available Interocular distance (IOD) [m]
only available if feature is licensed
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is valid
member.returns: the latest available IOD

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetLeftPupilRadius
member.summary:
returns the last available pupil radius of the left eye [m]
only available if feature is licensed
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is valid
member.returns: the lates available pupil radius for the left eye

member.summary:
returns the last available pupil radius of the right eye [m]
only available if feature is licensed
use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is valid

returns the last available pupil center of the right eye [m]

use smi_IsValid() to check whether the data is valid

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetLeftEyeImage
member.summary:
returns the last available eye image of the left eye as material
only available if feature is licensed
Precondition: smi_startEyeImageStreaming() has returned succesfully
member.returns: the latest available eye image of the left eye

member.name: M:SMI.SMIEyeTrackingUnity.smi_GetRightEyeImage
member.summary:
returns the last available eye image of the right eye as material
only available if feature is licensed
Precondition: smi_startEyeImageStreaming() has returned succesfully
member.returns: the latest available eye image of the right eye
